settings.custom_text_body: When we think of lube, we tend to think of it being used for penetration only - mainly with a penis or a dildo. settings.custom_text_title: Supportive for those with endo, PCOS and vaginismus
settings.custom_text_body: There are many vulvo-vaginal and menstrual conditions that can make sex and particularly penetration painful, due to friction and vaginal dryness. So if you or your lover ever experiences pain with sex, lube can be a total game changer for you.

It’s common for many women and vulva-owners of all ages to have low levels of natural lubrication for various reasons, such as anatomy type, hormonal changes, medications, menopause, or stress. Additionally, some women may experience arousal non-concordance, where their physical response does not match their level of sexual desire. 

So, they may be turned on but not necessarily ‘wet’. In these cases, using lube can help enhance sexual pleasure and reduce discomfort during sex.
